intro: Notopleura thesceloantha, commonly known as the broad-leafed star-milk vine, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, star-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds enclosed in a fibrous coating. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain areas.
